website_summaries.verdict: The WRT610N can satisfy both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz wireless clients with its solid performance, great design, ease of use, and its ability to work as a network storage device when coupled with an external hard drive.
pros: supports both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz Draft N simultaneously
cons: 2.4GHz close-range and mixed-mode throughput could be better

customer_reviews.title: Defective and Cannot Be Fixed
customer_reviews.text: The unit they sent out was completely useless. It was password locked by a previous user called Treehouse Media. The unit would not reset, ad without the password, I could not update the firmware which was defective. I contacted customer service from Linksys and was told that they could not even correct the issue. They stated the unit should not have been sold that way and that the Version 1 unit they sold is declared obsolete because of firmware and performance issues. Why is Amazon who I typically have had no problem with sending out a defective, inoperative piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Really bad... REALLY bad.
customer_reviews.text: This is without question, the worst router I've ever worked with. I had reservations about purchasing it originally due to the mixed reviews I had read. Now I know. This router just can't maintain a connection. It keeps dropping out every 15 minutes or so, sometimes recovering slightly, other times needing to be powered down and rebooted. I've updated the firmware and software since Linksys's claims those needed to be installed for the router to be more reliable. That didn't work at all... and by the way Linksys, having a product actually work out the box isn't a bad thing. All I can advise is to stay away from this one. Linksys doesn't deserve our money to support junk.
customer_reviews.author: Writing from experience

customer_reviews.title: Linksys WRT610N Simultaneous Dual-N Band Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Set up was pretty straight forward except that the included network manager software created some confusion. I still have not been able to make use of the storage attachment feature as it doesn't recognize the USB drive that I have. I also had trouble with one of my computers on the network not recognizing the attached network hard drive. After a couple of days and a number of calls I recreated the network on that computer and was once again able to get to the drive. The hard wired speed is great as I do a lot of internet activity and it's nice not to have sit and wait as a screen populate.
customer_reviews.author: donho

customer_reviews.title: Was A Good Router Until I Updated It With 7/28/09 Firmware
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for a couple of months and was very satisfied with it until a couple of days ago when I installed the 7/28/09 firmware. On Mac OS 10.5.7 systems complex web pages load much slower using wireless N, G, and Ethernet. What use to load in 1-2 seconds now takes 10 seconds to fully load. On my PCs web pages load only a little slower. Linksys does not have the older Jan 2009 B10 firmware for download anywhere. The lesson learned is that Linksys may build good routers but because firmware IS NOT TESTED it can not be recommeded.
customer_reviews.author: J. White

customer_reviews.title: Recommended ... Pretty much what I expected
customer_reviews.text: While I wish there were some more robust documentation in the box (actually, *any* documentation in the box would have been good), the internal/online help is more than pretty decent. Maybe not the best router for n00bs, but even so pretty easy to get right without much help. Wish it had better range, though; My wife and I expressly got the wireless so we can sit on the couch and surf or VPN to work ... it's only 30 feet away (though through one plaster wall) yet I only get 3-4 bars (I'd expect full strength at that range!) Only had it a few months, but two wireless laptops, wireless desktop (and three wired) all run seamlessly. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Hesse

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking about buying this item for its ability to receive a USB drive, and to use that USB drive as network drive - DON'T. The setup is difficult and the operation is super-buggy. And, if you use the Linksys SPA 9000 VOIP adapter, then especially DON'T. The compatibility problems as between this router and the SPA 9000 are well documented in the various posts, and they are accurate. I used this product for 2 months and just couldn't take its quirks anymore. I replaced it with a Trendnet router and everything has been fine. Linksys was better before it was Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: rocman

customer_reviews.title: Dealer gets five stars
customer_reviews.text: The dealer that shipped this gets five stars. The device itself gets three stars only because the first few months was great. After a few months Cisco dropped support for the software that was the deciding factor and now sold Linksys to someone else. The device itself is prone to overheating and needs to be unplugged and left to rest 5-10 minutes before plugging back in. My first and last Cisco/linksys product.
customer_reviews.author: JimTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: My company, of 50 developers, recently went all wireless, when moving to a new office. About 10 developers were allocated per router (well we use these as a wifi switches). We have some laptops with wifi G and all workstations have wifi N dongles. We selected this as we did not want to spend thousands of dollars with enterprise grade wireless gear. We are more than happy with the stability and the performance of it. With the price of this, we can even keep couple of them as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Mang

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as everyone is saying
customer_reviews.text: Going against all of the bad reviews warnings I decided to buy this router anyway and I am happy with it. From the research that I did the issues with the router seem to be heat related so I have it sitting on a wire shelf and I have not had any problems. The only quirp that I have is with the newest firmware which actually seems to disable you from using the USB harddrive feature, but roll it back and you are good to go !
customer_reviews.author: Rick J. Majcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade from an older Linksys router due to an ever-expanding home network. It was not quite as easy to setup as I thought it was going to be, but once up and running I can see a noticeable improvement in performance, especially during peak periods when multiple computers are on the Internet and the XBox is on Live simultaneously. Cons: The shared storage was difficult to setup and the USB port cannot be used for printer sharing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this wifi router
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a work horse for our house. It has everything running through it, and doesn't bat an eye. Was easy and flexible to set-up, and enjoy having features like QoS as well. Don't put in a tight space, however, because when this thing is getting plenty of use, it can get really hot. Not melting on me or anything, but it does get noticeably hot compared to other routers (wifi or otherwise) that I've owned...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Linksys WRT610N
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! Really easy to setup, manage, lots of options, and the UPNP server is fantastic! I had purchased a LaCie home UPNP a while ago, and while convenient, it has the problem of burning through disks because they can never spin-down. This one has the OS in the router, so the drive spins down when not needed! Great product... The dual-bands also is a big plus allowing my N connections not to drop in speed when B/G systems connect to the network! Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: This router is fantastic. I had an old Netgear wireless g router that worked pretty well until I got a new HP notebook with wireless N. The Netgear would drop the connection after any significant data downloads would override the buffer. I looked for the best wireless N router and I think I found it. The WRT610N was easy to setup, it is very fast and provides a strong signal throughout the house. The supplied Network Magic software is a great visual interface to control the entire network. I have a desktop, laptop, PS3, Wii and a cell phone connected to it so far. All work great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: After few years of using it I can say that it is one of the best routers out there, but you do have to know a bit about networking, just a few thing that you have to put in manually. Nothing any of us can't learn. So in more than 2 year I can confirm that is very reliable, no drops, good distance I get connection from about 20 yards that's the furthest I tried. Overall I would by it again.
customer_reviews.author: Vidis

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months past warranty
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great product. Yes, it's not for the novice. But a novice shouldn't be purchasing something like this. My complaint though is with reliability. Mine died after 14 months. Warranty of course, 12 months. If this was a $30 router I could live with that. But for the price I paid, I expect a much longer life. I don't see myself buying another Linksys product. Too bad, they were decent products before Cisco bought them out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Medow

customer_reviews.title: bad, very bad experience
customer_reviews.text: After spending twenty, yes twenty, hours on the phone with people I could hardly understand much of the time, I finally gave up on the Linksys router 610n. Five case numbers and about six techs could not get two computers working properly. The dropped connections, the stifled URLs, the constant rebooting to re-establish a connection all got to be too much. So I bought the D-link 655n and without a care in the world I got it hooked up and running beautifully with no dropped connections, no stifled URL, and no rebooting necessary. What a blessing to have a technology actually work. And I did it without a call routed to India. Cysco, what were you thinking?
customer_reviews.author: bigfootmm

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one..The first gave out after a long time of use..I enjoyed it so much I decided to go with the same model than a newer one because the newer ones do not compare to this one..I bought a newer one (EA 6300) and had to return it because it was really bad for a wireless connection..This one handles much better for LAN or wireless..If you connect get an external HD for it, it is somewhat slow..But for what I use it for it handles well enough...
customer_reviews.author: Calhoun904

customer_reviews.title: OK Router : Occassionally drops connection
customer_reviews.text: I purchased mainly to replace my 802.11b based linksys. Problem with older was my microwave and router did not like each other. That problem is now solved. Some sour points: On the new one WRT610N though my network card on my Dell 630 does hang sometime and I have to reboot the Dell laptop. (Not sure if it is dell problem or network card or router) I could not connect it (via wirelsss) with my brand new Brother laser printer MFC-7840W after spending 2 hours using secure setup. So Using wired setup. (Again not sure whether it is Brother problem or Linksys problem)
customer_reviews.author: amzn shpr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to replace a 2 year old Belkin N-1 Vision. The range and speed on the Linksys is far superior and the dual-band makes my media sharing so much more smooth. I was skeptical to buy this one based on some of the other reviews but I highly recommend it. So far, so good and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Rooter 4 Router

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Price beat several local stores like Best Buy by $40. Works good so far, although I dont really see any performance improvement over my US Robotics router which was junk. Linksys installation CD didnt work on my Win Vista machine. Good thing I know how to install a network. Router admin site isnt very specatacular. It's hard to find settings, and the local network table is buried deep, took me days to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Dcode

customer_reviews.title: WRT610N
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my WRT310n with the 610n, I have 8 devices between computers, Media center, printers, and game console and the 310 was lagging. This 610 has the ease of setup as the other Linksys products, had it set up and synced with my devices in 10 min. Immediatly I saw a difference in downloading on the internet, streaming and local network transfers of files. I recommend this router for anyone that has a larger than normal home network.
customer_reviews.author: RaZoR

customer_reviews.title: Fast speeds, 5Ghz requires a direct line of sight
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this router to replace my Linksys WRT-350N. The 2.4Ghz signals on the WRT610N were stronger than the WRT350N. However my notebook with Intel 4965AGN would not connect to the 5Ghz band from approx 75 feet and two walls away. [...] I now have overlapping 2.4Ghz broadcasts and a 5Ghz signal close to where my notebook computer is. The data transfer rates I get when moving files to my NAS are equivalent on the 5Ghz and a wired 1gigabit LAN. (I have a slow Linkstation NAS)
customer_reviews.author: Unnster

customer_reviews.title: WRT610N
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased and recieved promptly. Setup was very simple. I was able to setup my entire network in less than 1/2 an hour. I replaced a two year old netgear wireless router that always had issues with disconnecting from the dsl. With the Linksys I no longer have the issues that I had with previous router. I really like the Linksys EasyLink Advisor software.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne H

customer_reviews.title: great lil router
customer_reviews.text: Received the product very fast and in perfect shape. The item is as described and has completely met and exceeded my expectations. I would definitely order this again and I'm glad I read all the reviews first. In response to the Negative reviews below, I have not found them to be accurate. no complaints or flaws!
customer_reviews.author: brian erline

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Dual band rounter
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and set up. Files are slow to open on external hardrive which is connected to routers USB port. It opens files fast, but very slow to browse folders. Kind of expected it to be slower but not so bad when browsing. Don't think that's an issue with router, but more related to OS. However if you're buying this router for the USB port, it may not be as useful as you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Girl

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT610N Dual-N Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Linksys WRT610N Router several years ago and it worked well. I replaced it with an Cisco Linksys E1000 Router and then an AC 1750-EA6500. Linksys stays ahead of the game. I could not use AT&T Uverse internet (Wireless G) service because it was simply not up to speed for these advanced routers.
customer_reviews.author: Levelle M Laney

customer_reviews.title: Jim
customer_reviews.text: this product was installed without a hitch, everything went easy. followed the install wizzard and had both 2.4 and 5.8 ghz up and running in 20 min. been working now for a couple of weeks now without any problems. I was glad I upgraded, had a netgear model before, and it was locking up on me. we have 3 computers runing of this one and it works great. diffently worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: xyzh

customer_reviews.title: Linksys WRT610N Router
customer_reviews.text: Although I could have purchased a lower price Linksys router for our home, we use this router at our church. Both routers are working just fine. The external USB hard drive feature allowed us replace our church's Network Attach Storage Device and "free up" a port on the router. If you use this feature, you must temporarily turn off your Firewall before you can "map the drive." Then turn your Firewall back on.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first. Stopped working in less than a year. I ended up going to Walmart to buy a different wireless router. Too much money for poor reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Don Thompson

customer_reviews.title: nice router
customer_reviews.text: so far i notice that streaming video across my flat (apartment) is much better than with my Netgear router. i bought this for a future home entertainment system that will be built over time ($$$ is tight). i will be streaming video and media via the 5 ghz while using the standard stream for internet surfing and wireless printing. i just bought a matching usb dual channel adapter to use on a HTPC that i am piecing together. once everything is done i assume the dual channels will be a great benefit for streaming video and netflix from my other computer.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man (International Man of Intrigue)

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: i have been using an inexpensive g router and thought i could benefit from an n router after i purchased a new laptop with a compatible n adapter. it actually worked less efficiently than my old g router. poor signal, poor range, and just overall poor performance. fortunately, thanks to amazon, the return was painless
customer_reviews.author: Neal Esposito Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: I selected the Linksys WRT610N Duel-N Wireless router after considering multiple other options. I used this router to replace an older ZyXel router on my network. Despite some of the other reviews I've seen, setup was a breeze. I expect Cisco has updated their firmware considerably since their first release. I've noticed a definite speed increase to my network and so far have not had a single network drop. My previous router would drop ever so often. I have not tested any HD streaming yet, but so far so good with this router. It is one of only two true simultaneous routers on the market today. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pred

customer_reviews.title: Worked first time
customer_reviews.text: Researched routers thoroughly as I needed to replace my LinksysG. Was troubled by all the comments about problems installing the dual band router and reliability, but I had none, though I did make sure I went to Linksys for the latest software updates. The router services 2 HP desk tops, one running XP and the other Vista and a lap top running Vista. The range has been extended by at least 30 feet over the old G router and I can now get wireless connectivity through the whole house. The N router installed straight out of the box and there have been no problems with reliability in the 3 months it has been in use.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: This router performs as advertised. It broadcasts two different signals: b/g & n. The biggest problem that I had was the built in firewall that is set "medium" security as a default. The setting is in the firmware, and you must use the software to change it. None of this was made obvious during setup. I had to contact linksys customer support to get it where I wanted it. After that, it's been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Evans

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless N Router in existence today.
customer_reviews.text: This is without a doubt the best Wireless Router I have ever used. Considering the fact that I have experience with commercial Routers including Verizon high speed, Benkin, D-Link N and several other Home Office N Routers, but none came close to this Beast. It is truly a Monster. It is extremely easy to install. Security code can be change as often as you wish. The only con is price, a little expensive. I do not hesitate to give this unit a five star, 10 out of 10. Needless to say I do recommend this Router very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Rhoden

customer_reviews.title: Glad I upgraded.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the WRT610N and the 8 port linksys EZXS88W switch to replace my wireless access point LINKSYS WAP54G and my old linksys router. My son's laptop kept on dropping the connection over and over when using the WAP54G. My son asked that I upgrade the wireless connection for his birthday. The installation of the WRT610N went very smoothly. The wireless connection now works all the time. My son is extremely happy with the new wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Sandals sin ohos

customer_reviews.title: Not too reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to make it work for about 1 month, 1st of all i configurate this like my old WRT54GS router, everything looks ok then all configuration resets to factory defaults, after some research i noticed that this happens when the router gets too hot (why? i still dont know), until now when i used for a log period it gets hot and the connection to the internet losses. Right now i am trying to make the wireless works, apparently the 2.4ghz radio is been intefered by my cordless telephone.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Pineda Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: too bad Linksys got bought by Cisco, now Linksys is unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Linksys WRT610N, all would overheat and then became unreliable. Not the Linksys reliability I was used to back in the pre-Cisco days. Right now, my WRT610N's wireless just died for no reason whatsoever, it was working 5-min ago. I can still use the wired gigabit ports but no wireless and the router cannot accept connection to view the config page, resetting and powering on/off did nothing. After many years of being Linksys customer, I am giving up and going with D-Link. This product is unreliable, do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: thequickad

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This Linksys is the most expensive router I have purchased. For the price I expected trouble-free music streaming AND good tech support. I recieved neither. To be honest, I could have rated the router higher for some of its advanced features if the tech support had not been so useless.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Wood

customer_reviews.title: Linksys great dual n band router
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading many reviews of other routers. This router allows dual band use, was very easy to set up, and is much faster than my old belkin g router. Connections with comcast are more reliable -- for comcast. This router allows the use of the best type of security.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a replacement after the first router didn't work very well. We were hoping that the first one was defective. Not so much. The second one also overheats and for some reason makes my laptop boot up incredibly slowly. While we were waiting for the replacement unit we used our old router, which we obviously wanted to replace because we weren't happy with the performance. Even it did not interfere with the booting up of the laptop like this one does. We will make do with it, but am not happy with my first experience with Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT610N Simultaneous Dual-N Band Wireles Router
customer_reviews.text: The product worked all the way up to the most recent model that came out in the market. Actuaaly we retired the element otherwise it woud still be in use.
customer_reviews.author: fifi

customer_reviews.title: Just excellent; powerful and have a very long range.
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice device, easy to set up, nice admin software and can connect to other devices through concrete walls. I have one just to connect to a NINTENDO Wii that is placed at the other side of my house that have brick and concrete walls, works excellent.
customer_reviews.author: A. Iosue

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but very hard to operate (no MAC support from Lynksys)
customer_reviews.text: Hey guys, The product is great. It's working very well. Increase the speed of my cable net 3 times. But to connect an external hard disk on the usb port was really hard. I have a mac. After days of research on the net i find out that it has to be formatted as fat 32 an that's why i couldn't mounted before. Now, I have no idea how to access the hd from my work using the ftp server throw the internet. The user guide available on the linksys web site is confused and totally incomplete. Maybe in a mouth I'll be able to use all the functions of this amazing product. TKS SAM
customer_reviews.author: Samuel W. Abatzoglou

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to install on my folks house. If compared to the Belkin others I had purchased before, it's a piece of cake to setup. I really liked the software and features. Easy and any rookie could set it up. Recommend it fully.
customer_reviews.author: Edney Fernandes

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: The router works great but the initial setup was not that easy. The network magic provides graphical details of devices connected to the router and was helpfull in the setup of 2 wireless TV bridges, Ipod, 2 laptop, and network shared drive. Adding a device is simplified by this software. I upgraded from WRTG router to this router for better Media streaming. However, I cannot detect much difference. There appears to be an improvement; but it still is slow with interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: soussi

customer_reviews.title: Lousy signal strength... you -want- external antennas
customer_reviews.text: Unless you're living in a 1 bedroom apartment, avoid this router. The old wrt54g it was supposed to replace had much better signal strength and range. Also, better firmware such as dd-wrt and openwrt do not yet run on the 610n.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good performance but for four years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router from Amazon on November 20, 2009. It has performed very well for four years. It has just stopped working yesterday (11/28/13) right on Thanksgiving. So I gave it three stars due to its good performance. I would have given it five stars if it had lasted longer (or routers generally breaks in four years? I don't know). :-\
customer_reviews.author: Akhara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 2 year old WRT54G router with the WRT610N. The installation was easy. The performance of the wired and wireless connections on our home network has improved significantly. I attached a 500GB Seagate external hard drive using the Storage Link feature and it is working very well for backups and file sharing. The file copy performance to the networked drive is better than when it was directly connected to one PC and shared to the other devices on the network. So far, this is the best router than i have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Wumpus55

customer_reviews.title: Difficult item
customer_reviews.text: This did not last very long. I replaced my Netgear that died, this item lasted 1 year 1 month. Not very happy, now back to Netgear as it lasts much longer and a better product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: lynksys wrt610n
customer_reviews.text: this is the perfect router i have a big home and no problems connecting from anywhere in the house. plus the wireless blueray player streams video flawlessly.what are you waiting for go out and buy it
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T. Donovan

customer_reviews.title: A Really great product!
customer_reviews.text: This wireless router is by far everything that i have come to expect from such a device. The setup was clear and concise, even tho i had to trouble shoot it just once, it was still definitely a pleasant experience. I would recommend this product to anyone who uses multiple devices on their network for fast data transfers and a reliable connection. For the price however, i do feel that they could have included the FULL "Network Magic" program to make the experience much more affordable and simplified. I have yet to decide whether i want to upgrade from basic or not.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Now works great with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: While the third-party DD-WRT firmware is a work in progress, it now fully supports this router. If you use the latest DD-WRT builds, either 14144 or 14289, you will have great success with DD-WRT on this router.
customer_reviews.author: N. Doren

customer_reviews.title: All the bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: The high band has much less range than the standard 2.4Ghz band, which is one of the main differentiators of this model from the less expensive ones. A couple walls and about 30' before performance struggles in my home. At that range I still get "excellent" signal strength using the standard band. I also bought this model for the USB port to add an external drive. Otherwise, easy initial configuration, did the firmware update, and no problems - great unit.
customer_reviews.author: QMan

customer_reviews.title: PERFACT
customer_reviews.text: this is the best router i used so far. I used dlink 825/855 but this is the best. dlink is not good. it disconnect so many times. and the speed in dlink is not good in wireless. but this one is really good. noce things to buy. and in amazon its best place to buy trust me. i paid 120 which is a great deallllllll. i never saw this price anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Fahim Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Wireless good - storage bad
customer_reviews.text: The wireless aspect of the device is fine, but the reason I purchased this model was the storage. The storage is horrid for a Cisco product - non-optimal file system and flaky results. Sometimes storage works and other times it doesn't - tried several disk drives. I know Cisco has struggled with this but was hoping the newer revision would be better and after all it isn't that hard - think about how many PC makers have been able to make a USB drive work consistently for the past several years. Regards.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older router that I was using to create a DMZ. This was the internal router and immediately starting having performance problems. I would continually have to reboot the device to maintain stability. It would also drop my wireless connections. Don't buy this router...save yourself some headaches.
customer_reviews.author: MarkL

customer_reviews.title: No shipping details for this seller
customer_reviews.text: I paid 3 - 5 day shipping only to learn that the shipping estimate was 13 days. I would never buy anything from BinkieMelane again. I'm sure the router will be fine once it finally arrives, but I'll reserve judgement on this for later. Below is an email I sent them: "Is there any tracking information or can you tell me when this is being delivered. I live in Minnesota and it's been about -10 degrees every day. If it's delivers and it sits outside for more than an hour or so it will freeze solid. Will this damage it? If so I'll need to know when it's coming."
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Product - Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: This unit was very easy to set up and I like the Network Magic software that is offered. Everything connected with each other easily and no sweat. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer From Wayback

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: February 15, 2011, the fan is still working great and it is still quiet. I like this router. It is easy to setup, stylish and straight forward. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: My Profile

customer_reviews.title: Would do it again in an instant
customer_reviews.text: Was one of the easiest setups ever. No problems connectiong PCs, Xbox, WII, or printers The USB share is perfect for a home with multiple PCs, just connected an Iomega and away we went (one note on the share, when it asks for the password use the original 'admin', not what you may have changed it to, minor irritant easily rectified). And the best part was Amazon got it there 4 days early:)
customer_reviews.author: RMP

customer_reviews.title: good router
customer_reviews.text: used for ~6 weeks so far. easily connected to all my equipment using both bands simultaneously. it's been reliable in my small, one-level house with fast connections and no dropped connections on my 7 n/g connected devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hardware problems
customer_reviews.text: After noticing problems with the 5ghz range working with 2.4 at the same time I was noticing dropouts as well. Linksys said forums are not "their official statement" aka, there is word out this initial run of devices may be defective. Not sure if it is a problem with firmware or hardware but they recommended sending it back for a replacement. This does not bode well for those looking at purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: CheezBizkut

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and still running as good as the day purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Sean D.

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a brease. After hearing about others who had purchased earlier wireless routers from Linksys, I was reluctant to purchase this one. After pulling it out of the box and plugging it in, I was set up in a few minutes. After setting it up I was able to go back and change settings easily.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 moths past warranty
customer_reviews.text: No idea how something with no moving parts can just break, but one day the router started crashing every couple hours. Got worse and worse and now it's basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Gilde

customer_reviews.title: Good buy; PRO easy setup; CON pricey
customer_reviews.text: Nice router - setup was piece of cake with dynamic on screen instructions.
customer_reviews.author: AZUSMCvet74

customer_reviews.title: Dual N Band Wireless Router: Linksys
customer_reviews.text: The up to date Dual N Band Router by Linksys meets the stated attributes by the company and it is very simple to set up a protected home network.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great working item
customer_reviews.text: Recommend this item to anyone Works great, more than I need Great item, I would recommend this to any and everyone. Why so many words here?
customer_reviews.author: Frank H. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Great Router, has good range, easy to setup and use.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied ButtKicker User

customer_reviews.title: Linksys
customer_reviews.text: Still working like a champ 5 years later. I even flashed it with dd-WRT firmware. Router is used in addition to my Newer Linksys EA4500
customer_reviews.author: Tee Oh Double Dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Nice box, easy to setup and use, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Within 10 minutes or so after unpacking this, I was up and running securely with a shared storage device attached. The setup CD, while a little slow, worked perfectly without any problems. I liked that--unlike setup programs in previous routers I've owned--this one made sure I set it up to be secure. Wired and wireless clients, XP,Vista and Mac, are all working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald F. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice Router
customer_reviews.text: Easy to Set up and increased my speed and reception than from old G wireless router (WRT54G). Amazon delivered and price was $20 than from Best Buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: By far the best router that I have used or installed. Up and running in less than five minutes. Origanally, bought a Belkin Wireless N, Could not get it to work after 2 hours with technical support. Tried a second Belkin and still no luck after 2 hours with technical support. Ordered the Cisco WRT610N from Amazon. Amazing how easy to insall and excellent speed and range. No wonder CISCO is number 1.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works fine once configured
customer_reviews.text: I found the install program useless as I run Linux. But being familiar with other Linksys router configurations I was able to logon with the web interface to configure. The FTP and USB On-Line storage setup (defining folders and permissions) issues were a bit confusing at first. They work but not as you might expect the first time through.
customer_reviews.author: D. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Continually drops connections and the N never worked
customer_reviews.text: My main purpose in writing this review is to confirm everyone else's bad experiences with this product and help bring the overall rating down to what it most definitely should be. It just doesn't work. Continued dropped connections and very low signal with N. I'm finally biting the bullet and buying another router because I can't keep dealing with the problems. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Orrell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: so far so good i recommned this products for people that have both Media and data concerns.so far so good. set up was easy and self explnatorty
customer_reviews.author: GrtoneJames23

customer_reviews.title: bad power connection
customer_reviews.text: Power cable connection has been loose since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: G dog

customer_reviews.title: Sexy, Functional, but weak
customer_reviews.text: There are two radios - they both work independently. I thought that if I got this new fancy router that I could do away with the old two I had. Turns out I still need a second one to cover my 2 story 2K SQF house... I have the router smack in the middle of the house. Setup was a snap... I've never had to reboot it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Koniar

customer_reviews.title: Needs a ton of work
customer_reviews.text: No range, frequently crashes and freezes even with low activity. I simply cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Van Horn

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my linksys wrt54g as it didnot cover my entire house. This model has a much much bigger range and feature set. Love it...
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Zeeshan Chaudhry

customer_reviews.title: Support Stinks
customer_reviews.text: My router works well, but after the router has run for a week, it will not allow me to log on to it. I get an invalid IPC address error. The Linksys support team have been completely useless in resolving the problem. They seem to have support script that they follow, and if the problem does not comform to the script, the customer is out of luck. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great router, the setup sucks and you have to do it manually, other than that great performance!
customer_reviews.author: Alek Hartzog

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs way up
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much blows away the older 8.10g Linksys router I had previously. No problems connecting from anywhere in the house with no disconnects or drops. A few minor manual adjustments setting up the router - but pretty much trouble free.
customer_reviews.author: T. Reppert

customer_reviews.title: Ease of setup for linksys router
customer_reviews.text: Linksys includes a program called Network Magic with its linksys WRT610N router. This program only includes the basic setup, but it well worth it. I was able to set up a lan system with a dekstop using vista with a laptop running Windows 7. It was a snap. I can print from either computer, exchange files, and use my ip connection on both computers.
customer_reviews.author: Leadfootlady

customer_reviews.title: Great Router!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old Linksys router and I am glad I did. The range is fantastic as are the speeds. Very easy to setup and maintain. The cost is a bit higher than the competition but sometimes you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Logan

customer_reviews.title: OK Range, otherwise Good functionality.
customer_reviews.text: The router did not improve the signal strength over the previous Linksys router it replaced, and I see limited application for the second band as it's signal strength is lower than the standard band, even when using a new linksys adapter at the remote computer. Throughput was up somewhat and it was fairly simple to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Deb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The dual band works excellent. Easy to set up. Best using the web browser set up. I use both MAC filtering and WEP security. I set up the kids computers, I-touchs and Tivo's on the 2.4 band and reserve the 5.0 band for the wife and I's computers. Extremely fast.
customer_reviews.author: Intercooler

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the range they claim.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite the range that is published. I figured that the 2.5 and 5 Ghz frequencies would work through walls better than it does. Also has issues near fluorescent lights...avoid them.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up; great operation
customer_reviews.text: Based on reviews on a web site I got from Google (can't remember exact one) and Amazon customer reviews, I selected this router; set up went very smoothly; easily established link to laptop; and easily converted PC Desktop to wireless; have used for about 1 month with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Cisco has range.
customer_reviews.text: The new wireless router with dual band from Linksys by Cisco works great and the range through out the house is much better than the two previous routers I used. All laptops in multiple places used concurrently worked well. This router rarely drops and proved the best so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great product, wonderful delivery timeframe, perfect condition as advertised
customer_reviews.text: One item - blue ethernet network cable was missing but inexpensive to replace. Product arrived in advertised condition and works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Roy E Clemans

customer_reviews.title: The best one yet
customer_reviews.text: I have had my share of routers and this one is by far the best one I have had. The range is excellent and if you play games wired it is very fast. I dont say buy this one but I do say to do research and you will probably be back to the WRT610N
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Petrocelli Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I was wrong with this,
customer_reviews.text: As an Engineer, I thought I should be able to figure it out how to get this to work. I was wrong. After three technical support phone calls and 8 hours wasted, I gave up and bought Dlink DIR-655 instead. Should have trusted most of your reviews. here are the problems - Ethernet port should be GB on blue light and 100mb on green light according to the menu. Mine shown opposite. - Connection speed keep changing from 270mbit to 15mbit. Youtube session keep dropping. Tech support engineer was patient to try all configuration options and end up tell me possible a defective item Dlink DIR-655 installed was easy and constantly at 300mbit
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Linksys WRT 610N Router
customer_reviews.text: The Route was easy to install. It was a replacement for the Linksys WRT 300N. I let the Network Magic Software do some of the work and I fine tuned the rest. I get more range on this WRT 600N than I did the WRT 300N.
customer_reviews.author: Cleophus

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: At the end of the day this did not increase my home bandwith as I thought it would. Plus side easy set up, everything work with everything I have at home. If this is your first router this is a good deal. If you have something at home already look over the specs.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Remillard

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because it enabled us place MacBook Pros with 802.11n in 5ghz spectrum separate from 802.11g, which we maintain for iPhones. Note: Find out if you have v1 or v2. If you want to use a 3rd party firmware like DD-WRT or Tomato, V2 is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Roger H

customer_reviews.title: Streaming HD content wirelessly
customer_reviews.text: Working great to stream HD movies from a HP mediasmart home server to a HP mediasmart connect on the 5GHz N side. The The 2.4GHz is for the rest of my network. Excellent router at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast Connection Speed
customer_reviews.text: I had a router that had to be reset daily. The New Cisco product works like a charm. It's fast and reliable. I was able to install the router with no difficulties, and it works just great.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! Was easy to set up and have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: KRH

product_meta.title: Cisco-Linksys WRT610N Simultaneous Dual-N Band Wireless Router
product_meta.description:
Linksys Ultra RangePlus, Simultaneous Dual-N Band Wireless Router The Dual-Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router is really four devices in one box. First, there's the dual-band Wireless Access Point, which lets you connect to the network without wires. There's also a built-in 4-port full-duplex 10/100/1000 Switch to connect your wired-Ethernet devices together at up to gigabit speeds. The Router function ties it all together and lets your whole network share a high-speed cable or DSL Internet connection. We've also included a Storage Link that lets you easily add gigabytes of storage space onto your network using readily available USB 2.0 hard drives -- or plug in a USB flash disk for a convenient way to access your portable data files. The built-in Media Server streams music, video, and photos from the attached storage device to any UPnP compatible media adapter. And you can get to your files from anywhere in the world through the Internet. The Access Point built into the Router uses a dual-band version of the very latest wireless networking technology, Wireless-N (draft 802.11n). By overlaying the signals of multiple radios for each band, Wireless-N's "Multiple In, Multiple Out" (MIMO) technology multiplies the effective data rate. Unlike ordinary wireless networking technologies that are confused by signal reflections, MIMO actually uses these reflections to increase the range and reduce "dead spots" in the wireless coverage area. The robust signals travel farther, maintaining wireless connections much farther than standard Wireless-G.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer 

 The Dual-Band Wireless-N Gigabit Router is really four devices in one box. First, there's the dual-band Wireless Access Point, which lets you connect to the network without wires. There's also a built-in 4-port full-duplex 10/100/1000 Switch to connect your wired-Ethernet devices together at up to gigabit speeds. The Router function ties it all together and lets your whole network share a high-speed cable or DSL Internet connection. 

 With Wireless-N, the farther away you are, the more speed advantage you get. It works great with standard Wireless-G, -A, and -B equipment, but when both ends of the wireless link are Wireless-N, the router can increase the throughput even more by using twice as much radio band, yielding speeds much faster than standard Wireless-G. But unlike other speed-enhanced technologies, Wireless-N can dynamically enable this double-speed mode for Wireless-N devices, while still connecting to other wireless devices at their respective fastest speeds. In congested areas, the "good neighbor" mode ensures that the Router checks for other wireless devices in the area before gobbling up the radio band. 

 

 The incredible speed of Wireless-N and gigabit wired networking is ideal for media-centric applications like streaming video, gaming, and Voice over IP telephony, and gives you plenty of headroom to run multiple media-intense data streams through the network at the same time, with no degradation in performance. With the Linksys Wireless-N Storage Link Router at the center of your home or office network, you can easily add storage, share a high-speed Internet connection, files, printers and multi-player games, and run media-intensive applications at amazing speeds, without the hassle of stringing wires.



See more
feature_bullets: Internet-sharing Router and 4-port Gigabit Switch, with a built-in, dual-band, speed and range enhanced Wireless Access Point
Two simultaneous, separate, radio bands double your available bandwidth
MIMO technology uses multiple radios per band to create robust signals for maximum range and speed, with reduced dead spots
Connect a hard drive or flash-based USB storage device to allow access to your music, video.
